thread.title: NU reigns supreme
thread.title_full: NU reigns supreme | mb.com.ph | Philippine News

author: Christian Jacinto
title: NU reigns supreme
text:
by Christian Jacinto
October 3, 2015 Third time’s a charm for National University as it put itself in the history books, claiming its third straight UAAP Cheerdance Competition title yesterday in front of a sellout crowd at the Mall of Asia Arena.
The win allowed NU to join University of Santo Tomas and University of the Philippines as the only schools to ever complete a three-peat in the tournament’s 21 years of existence.
Members of the National University cheerdance team display fine form on its way to a first place finish.
(Ernie Sarmiento)
Fittingly, those are the two schools that the Bulldogs had to beat in order to make history as UST and UP finished second and third respectively in probably one of the closest calls in the history of the hugely popular side event.
Armed by a different kind of confidence after winning the last two competitions, the NU Pep Squad wowed the crowd anew with another edgy routine, this time using a pre-historic theme, with cavemen as the main characters.
That proved to be enough to get the nod of the judges and edge out those two schools who have had the lion’s share in terms of trophies in the annual festivities.
In total, National University finished with 668 points, ruling every single category in the competition.
“May flaws man kami sa pyramid, may tatlo pa kaming bala,” said National University coach Ghicka Bernabe, referring to the versatility of their routine.
“Ten times ang effort na binigay namin kaya kung may makakahabol man, sigurado akong di ganun kalapit,” she added.
The Salingawi Dance Troop of UST finished with 651.5 points for runnerup honors second, a steady improvement from last year’s bronze medal finish.
But the biggest surprise of the night was when host University of the Philippines finished third in the competition, much to the disapproval of netizens and the pro-UP crowd.
In total, UP finished with just 610.5 points.
UP wound up second last year and was extremely confident of taking first place this time.
With the theme ‘Utak at Puso’ the UP Pep Squad wowed the crowd with daring stunts and jumps and ended it up by forming a heart-shaped pyramid much to the delight of the 23,000 people in attendance.
But for the judges, that could only bring them to as far as third place, a respectable finish, but definitely below expectations of the UP community.
Far Eastern University settled for fourth place with University of the East finishing fifth, La Salle sixth while Adamson and Ateneo had to settle for seventh and eighth place respectively.
